messages.messageBody:
Glad you are ok, please keep in mind that sometimes being hurt from auto
accident
doesn't show up right away.
Please...keep watch over both of you.
you have my sympathies.

Lynn

messages.subject: Re: OT: Accident
messages.msgSnippet: Take a hot bath, drink some tea and relax tonight.  Jenni says try some vodka in your tea!  I hope you find some cheap tires!  I lucked into some when I needed
messages.messageBody:
Take a hot bath, drink some tea and relax tonight. Jenni says try
some vodka in your tea! I hope you find some cheap tires! I lucked
into some when I needed them so I hope you do too.

Bridget

along the

nor my son

accident,
> hitting high curb on the side. I blew both right tires, destroyed
a steel
> wheel. The other car drove off.
>
> It sucks...money is tight right now anyway because we've recently
bought a
> house, etc. --But we're okay. And someone once told me that a
problem you

problem.
> But, if you have any to spare---I could use sympathy. :)
>
> Kathryn

messages.subject: OT: Accident
messages.msgSnippet: We just got home from what was supposed to be a quick errand, but along the way we had a car accident.  It was nothing serious, and neither me nor my son was
messages.messageBody:
We just got home from what was supposed to be a quick errand, but along the
way we had a car accident. It was nothing serious, and neither me nor my son
was hurt. A car cut me off, and I braked and swerved to avoid an accident,
hitting high curb on the side. I blew both right tires, destroyed a steel
wheel. The other car drove off.

It sucks...money is tight right now anyway because we've recently bought a
house, etc. --But we're okay. And someone once told me that a problem you
can throw money at and make it go away is not a very interesting problem.
But, if you have any to spare---I could use sympathy. :)

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
